website_summaries.verdict: Small but mighty, this food warmer holds up to 20 ounces. It won't cook food, but it will keep it warm.
pros: Warms food better than a microwave
Good for leftovers, single meals, and keeping soup hot
Looks like a cool lunchbox and co-workers will be intrigued
Works well for bringing food to work, camping, and heating up dishes
Dishwasher-safe and inside liner is spill-proof
cons: May warp over time and not stay sealed
Inner container lid doesn't always stay on tight

customer_reviews.title: Love this food warmer
customer_reviews.text: Love this food warmer. I use it for lunch and dinner at work every day. I meal prep by freezing big batches of food in small freezerbags and place them inside of coffee mugs so the food is in a shape that will fit in the crockpot). I let the food cook from frozen for about 2 hours and it comes out perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Karen w.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a teacher!!
customer_reviews.text: After growing tired of having semi-hot or having to wait for forever on the microwave at work, I decided to purchase this. It is wonderful. I plug it in about an hour before I have to eat lunch and my food is perfectly warmed. As a teacher, I get tired of turkey sandwiches or trying to wolf down what's supposed to be a hot lunch but isn't for whatever reason. One of the best things is I don't have to worry about microwave explosions or having to clean up after someone else. Highly recommend for anyone who wants a hot lunch every once and while, and is crunched for time.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Williams

customer_reviews.title: Love this product!
customer_reviews.text: I travel for a living and a healthy diet is important. This thing changes the game! I read the reviews about the cord issue, but it seems to be resolved. If you want "warm" food, it takes about 30 mins. If you want "hot" food it takes a little bit longer. I would recommend heating up your food an hour before you are ready to eat. By then the contents are perfectly hot! Great for on the go! It fits perfectly into my suitcase and doesn't take up much room at all! Easy to clean as well. I recommend this to anyone who is look for a cheaper alternative to a hotlogic! Two thumps up!!
customer_reviews.author: Greer

customer_reviews.title: Merry “Crock”mas
customer_reviews.text: These little crock pots are adorable! I personalized them & gave them to the teachers as Christmas gifts & they loves them!
customer_reviews.author: SAELHO

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is freaking awesome. I'm currently eating leftover Mexican food for lunch by the water. I plug in my mini Crock-Pot at about 11 am and I have a hot lunch by 1pm. I used to just bring a sandwich but now my lunch possibilities are endless. Had it for a few months now and no problems at all as far as getting hot and working like it should. I HIGHLY recommend if you need a little variety for lunch.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Parlo

customer_reviews.title: Everyone should have one!
customer_reviews.text: Everyone needs a tiny crockpot! Seriously I love it! I work in a booth as a parking attendant and this little thing is amazing! It does not cook foods, it's just a little warmer. Left overs are great in it but you can even take a can of soup and dump it in and it heats it wonderfully.
customer_reviews.author: kristi schuh

customer_reviews.title: Can someone get back to me please?
customer_reviews.text: I like making easy stews and soups to bring to work and everyday this thing leaks. Is that right? The plastic lid inside doesn't seal anything and the actual cover that screws on also isn't a very good seal either. I'm wondering if all of them are like this or if I just got a faulty one. I would really prefer not to have my soup spilling everywhere. Thank you for getting back to me!
customer_reviews.author: Shello

customer_reviews.title: ... this for about a week now and I absolutely LOVE it! I prep my lunch (often leftovers) the ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for about a week now and I absolutely LOVE it! I prep my lunch (often leftovers) the night before in the removable bowl and in the morning I grab it from the fridge, put it in the crock and go. I get to work, plug it in and when my lunch time comes around, my lunch is perfectly heated and ready for me! Perfect for my casserole type dishes that I favor and no more Microwave use!!! Honestly, for the price, this has been a miracle worker for me! <3
customer_reviews.author: Erin Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Very useful
customer_reviews.text: Ultimately I think Crock-Pot should have put information in the instructions describing the temperatures the pot reaches after plugged in for X time. I recognize that different foods take different times to heat, but I would still like to know what to expect along those lines. That aside, this pot has been very useful in heating my lunch at my desk at work, and also when I'm out and about. I'm an equestrian, and have also used this at the barn to heat soup for a meal on-the-go. Really wonderful for those of us who wish to avoid the microwave. Great price, too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best items we got at Christmas. My wife takes her lunch to work. She didn’t like the taste of microwaved leftovers. We put leftovers from the evening meal in the little pot. Put it in the refrigerator. The next morning we put in the crock. When she gets to work she plugs it in and the leftovers are ready for lunch. Taste like they were fresh made We reheated : Wings Spaghetti Sliced chicken breast with grilled onions. Shredded beef. Taco meat.
customer_reviews.author: Dad of 4 girls

customer_reviews.title: Inner Lid Warped During First Use
customer_reviews.text: I just used it today and it takes about an hour and a half to warm up your food. My biggest complaint is that the inner lid warped within 40 minutes and it was the first time that I used the crock pot. The directions booklet clearly states to leave the inner lid on to ensure that the food warms up better but I would advise against it because it will warp the lid. I'm pretty sad that it got warped so fast. Other than that so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Lesley

customer_reviews.title: This Crock is a crock
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on October 19, 2016 and have enjoyed using it. However, today only 2 months later, when I plugged the device in, it sparked and now the cord attached to the Crock Pot is black and the wires are exposed, making it useless. This device is obviously a fire hazard and should be taken off the market.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Is it recyclable?  Throwing it away!
customer_reviews.text: Husband bought this because it was cheap and I needed something small. First off I was mad because he didnt look to see if the food container is stainless or aluminum. It does NOT state anywhere what this pot is made of. I assume it must be aluminum. If it were stainless they would have mentioned that on the box or somewhere. No way am I cooking in aluminum! Husband Did use it to warm up some leftover food before I threw it away. He really doesn't care what he puts in his body. Long story short, it leaked from the rim! Left a big mess down the side of the pot and counter. What a piece of crap!
customer_reviews.author: nancy kuczinski

customer_reviews.title: Works great in the van
customer_reviews.text: I love this crockpot! I work in the service industry and rarely have access to a microwave and was looking for something to use in the van with the inverter that is already installed. A friend told me about this and it’s been great. Now I can take leftovers for lunch the next day, I put them in the handy insert with a lid and keep them cold in my lunchbox until about 30 minutes before I want to eat and they are perfectly done for me. I highly recommend this to anyone looking for a small crockpot, it self heats and shuts off automatically.
customer_reviews.author: morris

customer_reviews.title: Heats well but lid pops off constantly.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this more than I do. It heats super well and is very practical, but the inner lid does NOT seal and pops off during every use, which means the food smells escape into the office. If I take off the outer lid to fix it, I burn my fingers and the whole inner lid slips inside the food bowl. Not ideal... I've had a Sunbeam brand one in Australia and it was perfect and never had this issue. I don't know if my lid is defective or not but Crock Pot needs to adjust their design!!
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Hot Lunches Are Back! 2018 Style!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best purchases I have made this year. It heats up your food and keeps it hot. Great thing about this is you can leave it plugged in while you eat and your food is hot from the first bite to the last bite. Wonderful. Spill proof. Amazing. It fits 20 oz of food which I thought wasn't going to be enough. Wow was I wrong, I actually had some left over. Buy one today! You won't regret your purchase. This will have you making home cooked meals for lunch. It is great with soups. I will update my review once I try spaghetti and mac n cheese. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: MsMoniH

customer_reviews.title: Good for heating at your desk
customer_reviews.text: If your workplace doesn't have a microwave, this is a good alternative to a hot meal. Cleaning: it has an inner liner that comes out so it's easy to clean Temperature Control: it has two settings - on and off. You will have to pay attention when heating your food. Size: it is small, easy to carry, and doesn't take up much room on desk, countertop or fridge. BUT! the seal does not always seal properly and it will leak - thus 4 and not 5 stars. You just have to pay attention and keep it upright, strictly upright, if you have something liquidy in it.
customer_reviews.author: senddebee

customer_reviews.title: So Easy To Use!
customer_reviews.text: Got this so I would be able to have a hot lunch without having to use the community microwave at school. It is so easy to use; open a can of soup, pour in the container, put the lid on, and the outside lid goes on over the top. I plug it in when I get to school and by lunch time it is piping hot. The inside metal part is easy to clean. The inside lid is plastic and did stain a bit because I had tomato soup but I don't care. This is so worth the $$!
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Lid is a down side.
customer_reviews.text: I really like crockpot in general so I bought this for my lunch at work. I bring soup, pasta, chili etc. I plug it in as soon as I arrive at my office, then in two hours it’s ready to eat. But the temperature is not hot enough for me sometimes. But I understand. Because this is just for reheating, not for cooking. My only complaint is that the inner lid is not closed tightly.
customer_reviews.author: Seong Minne Koh

customer_reviews.title: Nice, convenient, but inner lid does not seal
customer_reviews.text: I would have given this a total of five star review but like many of the other reviews that are already written the inside lid does not seal after the first initial use. Otherwise it's great to have on my desk to be able to warm up my lunch! Once I get ready to leave I usually put the inserts with the lid into a plastic baggie just to be safe so that nothing leaks out into my lunch bag.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy G.

customer_reviews.title: GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: We bought 2 of these for our kids to keep dinner hot for our swim practice travel. We plug them in when we get there and they get a hot dinner to go after. We treat the food as if we were rewarming in the microwave. Most with a splash of water. Homemade chicken n noodles, leftover lasagna, hot dogs, hamburger helper, beef stew, spaghetti, cooked chicken breast, hamburger patty. Canned things we just insert as is spaghettio type stuff, soup, as well as bbq weinies or chicken breast with any sauce. Its keeping us out of the drive thrus!
customer_reviews.author: djsully

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: Been using this awesome crock-pot for a few months now. Wow! Wish i had this a long time ago. I don't like using microwave or don't have a place to heat up my food. This crock-pot is so easy to use, large enough for 1 person. I place my food inside (rice, soup etc.) plug it in before lunch depending on how hot you want it 30-40 mins. You will have a good hot meal. Very easy to clean and great to have as long as you have a plug to plug it in.
customer_reviews.author: FE

customer_reviews.title: Teacher lunch just got better!
customer_reviews.text: A coworker told me about this and I love it!! The food tastes so much better than it does heated up in a microwave. I plug up my soup or casserole and 30 min to an hour later I’m ready to eat and it’s so hot! Like freshly cooked. The best part is no waiting at the microwave and the easy cleaning. Just pop the pot out and stick it in the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Mw

customer_reviews.title: Good but has issues
customer_reviews.text: This would be great but the lid that fits over the metal insert came warped and does not fit well. I cannot carry food in it without risk of it spilling out. That is a problem. The food gets very hot in it after a couple of hours. Almost too hot but that is better than not enough so I am ok with that. I just really wish the lid worked. In general I love the size and it fills my need for hot food on the job.
customer_reviews.author: BeachJean

customer_reviews.title: Great size for a can of soup!
customer_reviews.text: My wife got this for me for Christmas. It is great as I take it to work and leave it there (we have a sink). I either bring a can of soup from the store or leftovers from home and put it in when I get there in the morning. My soup is hot when it is lunch time. It is. Sry easy to clean and then put away for the day.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: my food is nice and hot
customer_reviews.text: This little thing is just plain neat! I can now have a hot lunch at work. I just plug it in about 45 minutes before lunchtime, and come lunchtime, my food is nice and hot. It works perfect with leftovers (both solid foods and soups). I haven't tried cooking any meals in it though - only leftovers. It fits my needs just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: Convenient, not portable
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had one of these before and I like them, I freeze 16 oz servings of all the meals I make so it is incredibly easy to just pop one of those in when I get to work and it’s ready for lunch time. This particular one however doesn’t seal, so it is not portable by any means. The lid just spins and never makes a tight seal. But if you’re just going to leave it in one place it’s a great alternative to the microwave.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: If you enjoy your car smelling like soup then this is for you!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I want to love this gaget, I really, really do but sadly that’s not the case. I have to say that the warming up factor is amazing, however if you travel any further than your living room, there is no guarantee that this device will stay sealed ...I’m not quite sure at the moment if I'm lucky that my back row of my car currently smells like chicken soup or not. The seal on this devise is nonexistent and the top barely locks into place, so keep that in mind when purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Geezy8279

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for any busy person with a short lunch and an outlet
customer_reviews.text: I have one already and bought another as a gift for my sister. I'm a Kindergarten teacher and have so much going on that it's hard to remember to bring lunch and microwave it every day -- not to mention we only get 15 minutes to eat. I plug this in every morning, pour some soup in, and have a delicious, hot lunch ready for me! My teammate also has one and uses hers to warm up even non-liquid foods, like pizza and pulled pork.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A must have for lunch on the go...you can have an easy hot lunch every day!!
customer_reviews.text: One of my favorite purchases!! I use it all the time! I like that the insert is portable so you don’t have to take the unit back & forth from home to work, just the insert. I usually add my food (leftovers, soup, etc), when I get to work, plug it in & in 3-4 hours, lunch is ready & hot! It fits a can of soup perfectly!! You will not be disappointed with this product!!
customer_reviews.author: Vicki Hopwood

customer_reviews.title: Met expectations
customer_reviews.text: I am renting office space in a suite and there isn't a break room. I really don't want to buy a microwave but I wanted some way to heat my food up. I was so excited when I came across this little lunch warmer. So far it has met my expectations. I would even say it does a better job than a microwave in warming my food. I plug it in when I first get to my office and by lunch, it is perfectly heated.
customer_reviews.author: auseymour

customer_reviews.title: A lunch time game changer!
customer_reviews.text: This is great to have at my desk at work. It’s perfect for a can of soup or chili and it comes out piping hot in about an hour. It is much fresher and tastes better than using a microwave. It is easy to clean in our break room sink I like that the cord stores on the bottom. The only thing I wish is that it had an on/off switch. Other than that it is a permanent fixture on my desk.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Nice to have something other than microwaves to heat up ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice to have something other than microwaves to heat up my lunch at work. I'd give it higher stars if it was faster at heating up my food (45-60 min) and if the replacement liner and inside lid wasn't the same cost as the Crockpot itself. But... you know... monopoly. Waiting for competition.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: Works well, very convenient, but the lids come off
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised and very handy for keeping food hot in a vehicle. There are two lids, one that pops on the inner container and one that screws on the out housing. Both lids come off very easily and led to spills and messes. Great concept, but the lids suck.
customer_reviews.author: chefkitty

customer_reviews.title: It’s not really a true mini crockpot
customer_reviews.text: I thought that it had a ceramic pot that came out for easier cleaning. Also, I thought it would be great for warming soups for my mother when I can’t be there to fix her lunch. But it gets too hot so the soup is boiling. Also, I thought it would have a glass top, like most other crock pots, not a cheap plastic top. I hate heating things in plastic because of the cancer causing chemicals that get released into your food.
customer_reviews.author: Good Read

customer_reviews.title: What a great idea!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this several times now and it hasn't disappointed. I brought canned soup up to a good temperature, and cold leftovers were wonderful, too. Things are much better than just microwaved. In fact, it was hard to tell that the food wasn't freshly prepared. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Literature Lover

customer_reviews.title: perfect for the office!
customer_reviews.text: I much prefer this for work over using a microwave. I use this for an array of leftovers, beans and rice, stir fry, veggies, eggs, just toss in whatever is in the frig that is good for lunch. Heats evenly and cleans up nicely. I get so many compliments. People think it is the cutest little thing ever. I purchased the pink :)
customer_reviews.author: particular shopper

customer_reviews.title: Best way to reheat my lunch
customer_reviews.text: I love this crock-pot and it's made my lunches so much more enjoyable (classroom teacher here). I cook up a bunch of meat and vegetables on Sunday and then portion it into quart sized bags to toss in the freezer. Each night I place one in the fridge, pour it into the crock-pot in the morning, and plug it in when I get to school. By the time its lunchtime the food is piping hot. This is such a great alternative to a microwave, which for me is across campus and always has a line and/or a mess.
customer_reviews.author: Francoise Aronfeld

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for work!! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this! I use it for work and it’s perfect for any type of soup or pasta. I plug it in when I get to work and by lunch time it’s the perfect temperature! No waiting in line for 30 minutes to use the microwave at work! Easy to clean - I leave the actual heating unit at my desk and only take the container home to clean it since that’s all the food touches.
customer_reviews.author: Charissa S.

customer_reviews.title: Overall good, but unsecure lid
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I like it. I eat my big meal of the day at lunch and I was concerned that this thing would be too small. It's not, it's a good size. The main problem with it is the lid. Mine doesn't fasten securely. It's not that big of a deal if you have rice or pasta or something like that, but if you have a soup or a stew you'll end up with a mess.
customer_reviews.author: Vedo

customer_reviews.title: Worked great on our camping trip
customer_reviews.text: While on our trip where we stayed in a cabin with only electric and a small refrigerator we used this to make 1 packet of oatmeal for breakfast. My husband would prepare with milk and set it up. After about 30 -40 minutes his oatmeal was done and very creamy. He tried 2 packets when we got home but seemed to not work as well even though he left it in longer due doubling the amount. All in all a good product when you want to have something hot to eat.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma in NC

customer_reviews.title: Awesome and a must for electricians!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this! He’s an electrician and sometimes it’s hard to find a microwave at work for lunches. He plugs it in at first break and by the time lunch rolls around, it’s nice and hot waiting for him! The leftovers we have put in it are delicious! Sometimes even better left over! He claims even McDonalds burgers are just like fresh from the drive thru! XD
customer_reviews.author: Nicolette S

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but the plastic cover (not colored top) is flimsy
customer_reviews.text: It does a good job of keeping food warm without burning it, but the plastic cover on the pot is flimsy. The plastic cover is what covers the opening of the pot and is separate from the colored cover. The plastic cover doesn't fully seal the pot and is slightly ajar no matter how hard you try to press down. I'm not sure if it's because we had kept the pot plugged in and on for a long period time as it was meant to keep warm the food my grandmother received in the nursing home. However, I don't think a product that is a heating element should have parts that can be so easily warped by heat.
customer_reviews.author: Natasha Kang

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little food warmer
customer_reviews.text: This little food warmer is great! I work in an office with no microwave, and was really tired of having to come up with cold lunch ideas while my left overs languished in my fridge at home. I just bring the insert back and forth from my house (leaving the base at work), and pop it in about 45 minutes to an hour before I want to eat. There is no food odor until I open the container, and my food is perfectly hot, but it doesn't overcook. Great value for what you get!
customer_reviews.author: Kristen V

customer_reviews.title: Warm food on a cold day
customer_reviews.text: Great for working construction. As long as you have power. I loved the 2 I purchased. They worked really good and gave us more lunch options. They really came in handy in the winter. There’s nothing better than warm food on a cold day. And they are pretty durable. I actually dropped one of them on concrete. Still works.
customer_reviews.author: JanetP

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done, but lid makes a mess!
customer_reviews.text: This Crock Pot gets the job done. I bought it for my desk at work to avoid having to use the unsanitary microwaves at work. It has one heat setting, which is pretty hot. Be careful about scorching your food if you turn it on in the morning and don't eat your food until lunch. One major design flaw (and the reason for deducting two stars) is the lid. The lid does not stay on, so when you are carrying the insert container, it must be upright or the contents will spill everywhere. It makes it very inconvenient to transport.
customer_reviews.author: The Boldens

customer_reviews.title: Where have you been all my life
customer_reviews.text: This is a godsend. I don't like to microwave leftovers, and I don't even own one at home. So to have this at work to heat up things I bring from home has meant I can finally get away from frozen dinners and sandwiches at work! I generally eat about 3 hours after getting to work, and my food is always piping hot. I've tried with pasta and soup so far and both have heated very nicely. The pasta didn't burn or stick, the sauce on it (cream sauce) didn't separate, and the soup was steaming. I love that you can leave the base and take the lidded container home to wash and refill....a great touch.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: I love this crock-pot
customer_reviews.text: It's the perfect size to heat a meal for one or two people. I have made a cheese dip in this crock and it did very well. When I use this crock, I plan on a two hour heating period. It's great for work lunches like chili beans, soups and salsa. I don't think you can use it to actually cook stuff like in a larger crock but it's great for heating stuff up! Great alternative to using the microwave.
customer_reviews.author: Amy S. Hicks

customer_reviews.title: A hit for the construction site!
customer_reviews.text: My man was a little jealous of his coworkers' one at the construction site (many don't have microwaves so it's hard to do hot lunches), so I ordered him this for christmas. I was skeptical, but got it anyways. It's so easy to take out the middle inside container, pop soup in there, and have him heat up for a nice warm lunch!
customer_reviews.author: NT

customer_reviews.title: Good quality but takes too long to heat up
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our son to take to school and while I like the brand and product, the teacher never has enough time to start it early enough so the food gets hot. At best it will be lukewarm after ~5-6 minutes. If you have the time to put it on and let it heat up, it is really great; but if you are expecting it to heat up fast, that is def not the case in our experience.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Chapra

customer_reviews.title: No temperature control
customer_reviews.text: I gave this product five stars because it has lived up to all manufacturer claims. It heats things up beautifully and to a warm temperature without overdoing the temperature and drying out the food. It would be nice to have a temperature setting, though. Maybe for a future version?
customer_reviews.author: John the AFOL

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT FOR ON THE GO/ACTIVE PEOPLE
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS CROCK POT WARMER!! It heats up fast within 2-3 hours and The Spill Proof Lid for the insert is Awesome! I’m taking it to my Local Skating Rink Now and a WARM LUNCH IS sometimes a MUST!!
customer_reviews.author: Kara Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Time savior!
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of running downstairs to heat up food- while waiting in line- and watching my time to get stuff done disappear. This little guy is amazing. I put my food in when I get to work, and when I have time to eat- it’s ready! Clean up is a breeze! Plus I like the idea I’m not microwaving all my food for lunch. Seems healthier? I love mine!! So far 2 coworkers have also got one and my husband! Do I get a commission? Lol!!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan O.

customer_reviews.title: My MIL bought one of these and recommended it to me
customer_reviews.text: I work mostly out of my car and I used to buy a lot of lunches on the go because I would get sick of packing the standard sandwich on the go lunch. My MIL bought one of these and recommended it to me. This product is awesome! I can now bring canned foods and leftovers with me. I have found that it usually takes 15-60 minutes depending on what I bring to heat up. I love this little crock pot and I have recommended it to all my work friends.
customer_reviews.author: M_Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my mom and she absolutely loves it! She was having a hard time planning healthy meals to have at work and this was just the best thing for her. She loves oatmeal so she puts all the ingredients in at home and cooks it at work. She’s also maxes varying soups and they’ve all come out great and in only a few hours. This was probably the best Christmas gift I purchased for someone last year. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Chelsie

customer_reviews.title: Handy!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Holds I plate worth of food!!! (Don’t put large bones. I got a car converter to use on my bus/truck! Perfect way to save money lol ;-) Only down fall is... you have to turn it on 30mins to a hr before your lunch break...it really doesn’t hold soup very well (Unless mind is the fact that
customer_reviews.author: mztootsiesroll

customer_reviews.title: Slight problem with the inner lid
customer_reviews.text: The Crock Pot perfect for heating lunch instead of using the microwave. This pot was much smaller than I expected. Works as wanted but needs a better inner lid. After few times use the lid doesn’t stay on so well. You’ll have to be careful when carrying it as it will probably spill.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: didn't notice the lid was separated and sauce from the food spilled outside and it is not easy to clean that
customer_reviews.text: Will really warm up food except the top lid pops up when hot which is expected. The problem is that it can not avoid the spill now since the lid is popped up when warm. It's okay if you heat it up and not move it anywhere anymore. I used our car outlet to warm up the food for our picnic but when I unplug, didn't notice the lid was separated and sauce from the food spilled outside and it is not easy to clean that. Still, it is useful and just make sure the food inside not in the max level.
customer_reviews.author: CSL Household

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't seal!!
customer_reviews.text: My only issue with this is that it doesn't seal!! Kind of a big issue because 1. Getting it to and from work is a hassle as it can't be tipped or jostled at ALL if there's anything remotely liquid in it and, 2. I drive truck for my job so the risk of spillage while I'm working is huge, too. Other than that, it works great! No soup in my future, though, I guess.....🙁
customer_reviews.author: Erin Hallis

customer_reviews.title: A quick, healthy way to warm your lunch at work
customer_reviews.text: I bought this years ago and am finally writing a review. This crock pot food warmer is truly one of my favorite things. I bring leftovers for lunch just about every day. I keep the warmer in a drawer at work and just take home the container to wash and load with more food for the next day. I eat at noon, so depending on how full it is, I plug it in anywhere from 11:15-30, and that's a perfect amount of time for my lunch to get hot by the time I am ready to eat. You don't get hot/cold spots like you do with the microwave. Awesome product. Would make a great gift.
customer_reviews.author: Jennie Adams

customer_reviews.title: The personal travel crockpot that rocks!
customer_reviews.text: This little crock pot rocks! So easy to use, carry and clean. A removable container allows you to fill it with almost anything. The cord wraps around the bottom of the unit making it easy to carry. Plug it up and your food is warm/ hit in minutes. No more waiting for the microwave at work. My food is ready to eat when I'm ready. It doesnt burn the food either. When it's time to clean the unit, simply lift the container out, wash it and return it. I get several compliments and inquries about it each time I use it. It's also a great gift idea as well.
customer_reviews.author: Yulonda Moore

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS
customer_reviews.text: If you bring your lunch this is such an awesome thing to have. I have literally saved so much money on food since this purchase. Now, almost every day, I bring my lunch instead of going out to eat. All of my coworkers compliment me on how cute the lunch crock is.
customer_reviews.author: AHarts

customer_reviews.title: Portable and Discreet !
customer_reviews.text: I like that it is not clear like some others so people cannot see what you have for lunch! It is lightweight so even a small child can carry it. My two issues with it is that it was a little smaller than I expected and it takes a long time to heat up my food. For example, I had shrimp and mashed potatoes and after one hour it was not warm enough for me to eat and enjoy. Despite this, I must say I am pleased with the purchase. I guess it is ideally suited for foods such as soup, noodles, porridge, cereal, oatmeal and so on.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Pipping hot Lunch. No lines
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I saw it on a blog Facebook from a blog post I saw. It came right on time and everyone at my job wanted to know where I got it from. I use it almost everyday and when others are going out for lunch or at the microwave line my food is pipping hot and ready to eat. I sit it at my desk and plug it up for 1 hr and I'm ready. Even 30 minutes does the trick on some meals. I am so please with this I am buying another one
customer_reviews.author: Torriesa Thomas

customer_reviews.title: I love this crock pot!
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd one I have bought. The first one was made differently and the cord got kinked and quit working. So far this one seems to have corrected that problem. My husband works in construction and likes a hot meal during the winter so he takes soups or chili in this and he says it is a MUST HAVE.
customer_reviews.author: L. Riley

customer_reviews.title: I love that the cord tucks away
customer_reviews.text: I finally took this to work. How ever did I live without it. I love that the cord tucks away. But word to the wise......I put fresh hot soup ( cooked in the big crock pot overnight) in at 6:30am. I got to work and plugged the mini in. At 1:00 pm it was still to hot to eat. It maintained that high temp very well. The next day the cold leftovers went well. The little cutie rolled off the seat in the car and there were no spills. Most importantly I didn't nave to stand in line at the microwave. Cleaning is a breeze because the little interior comes out.
customer_reviews.author: Reece

customer_reviews.title: I got this for a friend for her birthday
customer_reviews.text: she was really bad about taking something healthy for lunch. would grab something at the store or vending machine. now she takes her lunch every day. she Loves it! says it does Not cook her food anymore just heats it to the perfect temperature for eating.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: my husband was so sick of sandwiches and working construction in the winter, nothing tastes better than a warm home cooked meal. you need to buy a converter. my friend had problem with a different brand. This brand hard to find in Oregon. Glad we found it on amazon
customer_reviews.author: WMBS

customer_reviews.title: Picky Lady Says....
customer_reviews.text: I love using this at work, it warms without burning or overheating!! It's nice that I do not have to wait in line for my food, and it is fresh -- without using a microwave! They seem to have fixed the cord issues (where it connects to the pot -- they have a guard on it, so that it is safer now) You will really like this -- I'm a really picky lady, so yes, trust this review! :-)
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca'n'Kansas

customer_reviews.title: It does it's job very well.
customer_reviews.text: Was given as a gift but she uses it as I do mine, as we take to work each day for our meals. Plug in and it heats soups or casseroles. I have premade burritos, wrap in paper towels or foil and they get reheated. Baked potatoes are warmed and ready, cheese melts. Really a neat product.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I like that I don't need to use a microwave and no longer need to wait for my turn at the office. I ordered three of these and discovered each one has a flaw. The power cord for this red one is a little short. So I often has to stretch it out a bit when winding it around the base. Also, over time the inner lid no longer seals tight. If you don't mind these little flaws, I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome and a great size
customer_reviews.text: Plug it in at least an hour before you want your lunch hot! These are awesome and a great size! Fill with pre-cooked meat and top off with frozen vegetables in the morning before going to work and veggies turn out great and cooked perfectly. Leave plugged in if you get interruptions while eating at your desk and your lunch stays hot when you finally get to finish eating 2 hours later!
customer_reviews.author: bolognajacob

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really great crock pot for the office. I take left overs to work in the inside container that has a lid. I put them in the refrigerator until about 11:00 am. At that time I stick the container in the crock pot, plug it in and an hour later my lunch is nice and hot, all the way through, not like a microwave that heats in spots. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Macy

customer_reviews.title: Great lunch warmer, lid warps a bit over time
customer_reviews.text: Great way to have a hot lunch ready for you halfway through the day. Not sure how long it takes to heat up as I just plug it in when I get to work, but everything is piping hot 4 hours later when I go to lunch. Good volume for lunch, works with more than just soup. Lid starts to smell a bit after lots of uses and warps as well so it doesn't fit as nicely, but the screw top holds it in place just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Senpai!

customer_reviews.title: A Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I brought this small crock pot for my daughter to take to school. She loves it. She is able to take lunch to school and she doesn't have to worry about buying lunch on campus. This is so convenience. The best thing I brought for my college daughter.
customer_reviews.author: April Washington

customer_reviews.title: Just Right
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I needed. I work at a place where the microwave is just disgusting. I got to the point where I began taking salads everyday. In the winter, I like taking hot foods. I had to do something. When I found this gadget, I couldn't be happier. When I used it for the first time, I got at least 5 compliments and the same question, "Where did you get that? It heats soup, fried rice, and chicken tenders like a charm. I plug it in 1 to 1.5 hours before lunch. By lunchtime. My meal is perfectly heated. This gadget saved me from eating salads everyday. I get to enjoy hot food on a cold day.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly

customer_reviews.title: Great pot!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this! It reheats your food in less than an hour. I gave 4 stars because when it gets hot the top pops off making it difficult to get hot soups out. Also..I put a rubber band around the insert pot to carry it back and forth to work as I leave the pot itself at work. If you carry the entire pot the top stays on for transport. I love having my food nice and hot for lunch. It could use a cut off timer..but I still 💘 it!
customer_reviews.author: Master Teacher1

customer_reviews.title: HS teacher loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my sister-in-law, she's a high school teacher. She loves it! She's been using it for over a month now. She said she likes to make a big pot of soup on sundays and she brings that to work each day in the crockpot lunchbox. It's really easy for her to use.
customer_reviews.author: supjennifer

customer_reviews.title: Great little warmer
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my daughters to take to work. They are adorable. they have a aluminum inside and a plastic lid. Easy clean up, they get warm not hot but it can slightly burn the bottom of a thick item, dip, stew. The plastic lid is ok but an aluminum lid would be better, but the item doesn't get hot enough to melt the plastic but again it is heating up plastic. The cord wraps around the then tucks into the underside so it sits flat. Great product for anyone who has access to an electric outlet for an hour or so. Also great to take a hot dip (Artichoke green chile cheese) to a party.
customer_reviews.author: farbell

customer_reviews.title: Great but bulky
customer_reviews.text: Love this mini crockpot to bring my lunch in for college. Only downsides are it’s only one temperature and it’s pretty bulky. Other then that, it’s great. So far I find it easy to clean but I’m sure if you accidentally burn your food on the bottom, it will need to be soaked. Once my food is hot, I usually unplug it to prevent this from happening
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Perkins

customer_reviews.title: It's convenient. Works great.
customer_reviews.text: I love it! Very surprised how hot my lunch is. Leftovers, stews and soups are transported without spills. I just plug it in about an hour before lunchtime, although some dishes require a little longer. No more waiting in line for the microwave. Going on a trip soon. Hmm. Should I pack it?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great as a gift for teachers!
customer_reviews.text: I love how convenient it is for me to heat up my lunch while teaching. Teachers don’t really have lunch breaks at my school now due to Covid, so I needed to find a way to have hot lunches and watch my class. It was either this or a microwave. So I chose this for size, convenience, and my health. Microwaved food shouldn’t be an everyday thing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Conversation starter
customer_reviews.text: Without fail every time I use this someone will comment on it and say that they need one too! Also, it works great I plug it in an hour before my lunch and my food is piping hot I've also plugged it in a half hour before lunch and gotten similar results
customer_reviews.author: C. Grims

customer_reviews.title: better than nuking
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my lunch at my office. I’ve experimented with layering and have a recipe where I place small amounts of frozen seafood on top and by lunch all is delish (talking a minimum 90 mins in crock) Obviously, take care with your food safety. If you can be in one place for 1-2 hours, this lunch crock is great. I love it. My food is MUCH better than when microwaved.
customer_reviews.author: Rashishi

customer_reviews.title: Perfect when you do not have access to a microwave.
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have item if you are out and do not have a way to heat up your food. Sandwiches can become boring, but if you have access to an outlet, this is a wonderful way to ensure your food will be hot. I work in the blood banking industry and the staff who have to collect the blood at different mobile locations do not always have access to a microwave or the microwave is too far, taking minutes from their break. I do not recommend this product if you do not like your food to touch.
customer_reviews.author: Size Queen

customer_reviews.title: Great ilittle crockpot for hearty lunches.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my Fiancee. It works great to provide a warm lunch on his job sites. To reheat pasta or soup it takes about 45 minutes to get it nice and warm. It also holds the heat in the food once unplugged for a good 40 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: M Lo

customer_reviews.title: Love this product
customer_reviews.text: My husband has a soup at his desk each day! I wish I would have bought this a long while ago. He leaves the bigger contraption at work and only brings home the insert to put in the dishwasher. The top doesn't fit as tightly as before once it went through the dishwasher but we don't care - I'm not sure it was ever dishwasher safe anyway. He gets a nice soup to warm him, without the microwave taste!!
customer_reviews.author: Heimy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the office and cooking at your desk.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect my desk at work. I have tried everything it in already and it cooks evenly and only 90 min. for some really hot soup. One day when I was in the kitchen in the office, I have 4 people comment on how cute it is and perfect for work. I know of one person who went out that night and ordered one.
customer_reviews.author: T&JD

customer_reviews.title: A warmer.  Not a cooker
customer_reviews.text: As long as you realize this is not a cooker, but a warmer, you're good. I love this for lunch! I've taken leftover stew, chili, soup, crack chicken, and so many things! What an awesome break from fast food lunch. I had other people in the office wanting my lunch!
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: I love my lunch crockpot
customer_reviews.text: I love my lunch crockpot! It has truly changed what I can take to work for lunch. I hated microwaving leftovers that lost flavor, got tough or heated unevenly. Now I just put my leftovers in the insert the night before, plug my crockpot in 2 hours before lunch and I have a fantastic lunch all ready. I was pleasently surprised that there is not odor until you open up the insert lid, which is nice because it means my office doesn't smell like my lunch. This is a must have for anyone who regularly takes soup or leftovers for lunch.
customer_reviews.author: Svc

customer_reviews.title: Good tool. Not air tight, difficult transport
customer_reviews.text: This works great. My only complaint is that it doesn't seal very tigntly after the first time using it (I suspect the heat and steam may have damaged the seal). So it is not air tight, not good to put in a bag and it must remain upwright during transport. But if you look past that, I do like having it. I take it to work with me and it does exactly what I wanted it to.
customer_reviews.author: Lyndsi Erdman

customer_reviews.title: Prefect size portions
customer_reviews.text: I love this! I work for a 911 center and can use this at my desk. I can’t always get up to heat food efficiently , and to order lunch every day is costly. Perfect oatmeal for breakfast or reheated scrambled eggs. Lunch options are endless .. soup, chili (frozen to eat time is 1 hour), dinner leftovers ... I wish I knew about this 20 ears ago.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli

customer_reviews.title: Good, but inside plastic cover retains food smells
customer_reviews.text: A great tool to prepare lunch cup meals. Meals come out perfect every single time. Great to have next to office desk since smells do not leak out while cooking. One major downfall, however, is that the inside plastic liner cover retains food smells after cooking spicy items. Tried using comet, vinegar, activated charcoal, repeated dishwasher cycles, etc. to no avail. No longer able to use lunch crock for bland food items such as oatmeal because of the smell it will take on from the cover.
customer_reviews.author: Topaz

customer_reviews.title: Love this!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned several crackpots in my life but this one is by far the cutest and absolutely the most practical for anyone who ever eats lunch away from home. It only warms your food. I have a friend who is a long haul trucker and he loves it as well. The inside is removable for easy cleaning too!
customer_reviews.author: Brittney Marie

customer_reviews.title: If you hate to use the microwave this is the best
customer_reviews.text: I avoid using the microwave at all costs. When I make something I dislike using the microwave to reheat also at work there's always a line of people waiting to use it. I put soup, pasta, veggies or whatever I need to heat up in this gem. You plug it in and it warms up the food nice. It doesn't cook it or make it soggy.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Wilcox

customer_reviews.title: great for  lunch time
customer_reviews.text: I put in a can of soup into this mini crockpot when I get to work in the morning. By lunch time, it is perfect eating temp and is ready to go! Easy to clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Maryland Girl

customer_reviews.title: worked excellent for my needs
customer_reviews.text: Mom was in hospital and we wanted to get her some quality food and better soup's. This made it absolutely simple to heat things up quickly. All the doctors and nurses that came her room noticed it and were impressed. They all wanted to know where I purchased from and who made it.....This thing rocks!
customer_reviews.author: AMZbuyer

customer_reviews.title: The perfect take to work lunch box
customer_reviews.text: I take this to work every day. I like to eat my own cooking and the container is a perfect single serving size. Heats up quickly, cleans very easy. and has good looks to boot. Get that fast food out of your life and bring your own cooking to work.
customer_reviews.author: David B.

customer_reviews.title: Teachers this is for you! Microwave alternative.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best thing to have for teachers! As we don’t have a lot of time to eat and navigate through all we have to do for the day. Being able to put some leftovers or soup, etc in this crock pot, plug it in and eat is the best! I plug it in about 15-30mins prior to taking my students to lunch and it’s ready to eat! I highly recommend for teachers or anyone who wants a microwave alternative. (I even got my Truck driving mother-in-law one. She looooves it!)
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Felix

customer_reviews.title: It leaks!!
customer_reviews.text: This little crock pot is amazing except for the fact that it leaks unless it's kept directly upright, which is difficult if you're taking it anywhere. The little lid on the inside sits on top of the container, but doesn't seal it off and the lid just twists into place to keep the lid on, but still with leakage. Very, very disappointed in that, as I was using it for soup, otherwise this would be a five star review.
customer_reviews.author: Mary B.

product_meta.title: Crock-Pot SCCPLC200PK-NP Lunch Crock Food Warmer, Pink, 20oz
product_meta.description: Color:PinkEnjoy warm, hearty lunches without leaving your desk! The Crock-Pot 20-Ounce Lunch Crock Food Warmer is a lunch tote and food warmer in one that warms food while you work, for delicious on-the-go meals that are ready when and wherever you are. Convenient portability features include an outer lid, easy-carry handle, and cord storage. Plus, the container is removable for filling and transporting, eliminating the need to travel with the entire unit.
feature_bullets: 20-ounce capacity is the perfect size for personal portion lunches or for dips
Bring the comfort of flavorful meals on-the-go
Dishwasher-safe removable container with spill-proof lid
Exterior doesn't get hot when in use

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars5,039 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
